primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God offers a new identity and a way out of the 'rat race' of Babylonian coercion to weary exiles through a free covenant.

subject.identificatie: God / The Voice of the Poet (as God's mouthpiece)
tekstueel_bewijs: I will make with you an everlasting covenant
God stands outside the competitive, coercive practices
free wine, free bread, free milk
peace that the world cannot give
For my thoughts are not your thoughts

helper.identificatie: Jesus / The Poet / The Gospel Offer
tekstueel_bewijs: Softly and tenderly, Jesus is calling
You have been given a visa in this good poem

tegenstander.identificatie: Babylon / The Rat Race / The False Self
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Babylon represents a totalizing system of value that erodes the image of God and enslaves the soul.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of 'departing' or 'reimagining' existence based on the offer.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The departure (ethics) is a 'permit' or 'authorization' granted by the primary program (grace).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God stands outside the competitive, coercive practices.
The LORD will go before you.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Why do you spend your money...?
You shall go out in joy.
We labor for that which does not satisfy.

voorbeelden: This is not an imperative; God does not nag.
when you are ready, at your own pace
It was a reimagining of one’s existence.
It is rather an invitation and permit.
You have been given a visa.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Authorization' (Pouvoir). It grants the hearer the power/permission to stop performing, rather than demanding a new performance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Exile/Stress) through ~S1 (Futile Labor) to S1 (Free Offer) resulting in ~S2 (Peaceful Departure).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'difference'—His thoughts are not ours; He acts outside the system of exchange.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'rat race' is described as depleting and soul-destroying.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions God as the initiator of a free gift that requires no human capital. The 'doing' is framed as a response to an already-granted 'visa'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The departure is to depart Babylon and to go back to Jewishness.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
God is not subject to Babylonian whim, but holds to a resolve for us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (David, Isaiah) are used to illustrate God's promise rather than human effort.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, de-escalation of anxiety, sense of being 'first class'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic comfort; the hearer is the object of God's saving speech.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'offer' to the 'departure' is handled as a logical flow from identity to vocation.
spanning_punten: The phrase 'to accept that truth takes some doing' briefly introduces a human Subject, but is immediately softened by the hymn 'Softly and Tenderly'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: reimagining of one’s existence... outside the grip of endless expectations

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon uses the 'Voice' and 'Poetry' as the means of grace/competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'rat-dom'—a loss of true humanity to a coercive system.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a classic grace-narrative where God is the Subject of the 'Offer' and 'Difference', and the hearer is the Receiver of a 'Visa'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Savoir-faire (the 'how' of living in Babylon).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Briefly describe what a 'myrtle' looks like in a 'thorn' office environment.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Babylon is well-described but could be more 'Heavy'.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Emphasize that we cannot leave Babylon on our own power.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To prevent the 'departure' from sounding like a mere psychological choice.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses narrative actants to liberate the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'rat' metaphor; actantial analysis reveals God is the one doing the 'de-ratting'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah's context; Greimas shows how the text functions as a 'permit' for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'departure' is not a new Law (Devoir) but a granted Power (Pouvoir).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by making the 'departure' a result of God's 'visa' rather than a hero's journey.
